channel.title: Complex Statements :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides Finally, let’s look at how we can rewrite some of our previous Python programs by combining expressions into more complex statements. Python allows us to perform multiple actions on a single line of code, provided they can all be combined in some way to create a single statement. Let’s consider the example on the previous page, shown here: text_one = input("Enter the first number: ") one = int(text_one) text_two = input("Enter the second number: ") two = int(text_two) one = one * one two = two * two total = one + two print(f"The sum of squares of {one} and {two} is {total}") There are many ways we can write this program to perform the same work.
